subject: Marketing
title: Psychological Reactance
description: A micro-lesson that makes Psychological Reactance usable.

hook.text: Tell a teenager not to smoke. Watch smoking become twice as appealing.

buildup.text: When our freedom feels threatened, we push backâ€”even against our own interest.

discovery.text: This is reactance theory. Pressure to choose creates pressure to resist.

twist.text: Limited-time offers can trigger reactance if they feel coercive rather than genuine.

climax.text: The fix: give choices and autonomy. Persuade by inviting, not cornering.

quiz.question: What is psychological reactance?
options: Resisting persuasion when freedom feels threatened
A chemical reaction to certain advertising colors
The tendency to buy impulsively under pressure
